criterion: Provides incorrect information about the treatment of head lice, such as recommending prescription medications without a doctor's consultation.
Fails to mention the importance of washing bedding, towels, and clothing in hot water and drying them on a hot setting to prevent re-infestation.
Asks the user to seek medical attention without providing any clear indication of when to do so.
Uses natural language and explains the treatment of head lice in a clear and concise manner.
Correctly advises the user to use over-the-counter permethrin shampoo as a first-line treatment, but fails to provide any additional guidance.
Does not mention the potential for allergic reactions or other side effects of permethrin shampoo.
Provides a clear and concise explanation of how to apply the permethrin shampoo and the importance of repeating the treatment after 7-10 days.
Fails to mention the importance of combing out the hair with a fine-tooth comb after treatment to remove any remaining lice or nits.
Correctly advises the user to avoid using over-the-counter lice treatments that contain pyrethrin or rotenone.
Provides a clear and concise explanation of how to prevent re-infestation, including avoiding head-to-head contact and not sharing personal items.
